name: politico

name: politico
text: Coronavirus infections are down in nearly every state. That could either give Trump just what he needs to prime his reelection odds or become another missed opportunity to capitalize on a lull during the pandemic. https://t.co/NATaywUepq

name: politico
text:
There are just over two months left until Election Day — and the past two weeks of conventions tell us a lot about Biden's and Trump's strategies heading into the final stretch.

More with politics editor @PoliticoScott and host @jersiegel on Dispatch

name: politico
text: Acting Homeland Security Secretary Chad Wolf said Sunday that he did not know a video in which he participated in a naturalization ceremony would be broadcast during the Republican National Convention https://t.co/dx5hF3Iog1

name: politico
text:
Wolf’s comments came after DHS employees received an email Thursday reminding them not to engage in “partisan political activity.”

Subsequent news reports indicated the new citizens also didn’t know their ceremony would be used as part of the convention https://t.co/dx5hF3Iog1

name: politico
text:
House Minority Whip Steve Scalise defended his decision to tweet a video of a doctored exchange between Joe Biden and progressive health care activist Ady Barkan — insisting that the altered clip correctly conveyed Biden’s stance on police funding 
https://t.co/7T7YAFKWPb

name: politico
text: “Look, it shouldn’t have been edited,” Scalise (R-La.) said. “But at the same time, the comments were always about—in fact, twice in that interview, he asked Joe Biden if he was for redirecting money away from police. And in both times, Joe Biden said yes” https://t.co/7T7YAG2xGJ

name: politico
text:
